summary: Shift scope to a user-generated companion marketplace where users can create their own profiles, chat freely with matches, and pay a one-time ₹10 fee to create a profile.

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity sign-in and basic user roles (guest, signed-in user, admin) to control access to creating/editing companion profiles and reviewing booking requests.
Create public-facing pages to browse and view individual companion profiles in a luxury magazine-inspired style (strictly non-explicit, adult-oriented branding only).
Add companion profile management (create, edit, publish/unpublish) for authenticated admins, including moderation controls to remove or hide profiles.
Implement a booking request flow where users can submit a request to a selected companion; admins can review, accept/reject, and track status (no real-time chat).
Add legal/compliance UX: age gate, Terms/Disclaimer page, and clear “18+ only” indicators throughout the app.
Define and apply a coherent visual theme consistent across all pages: a black/cream/gold luxury editorial aesthetic with strong typography, high-contrast layout, and “magazine spread” components.
Generate and include required static brand assets (logo + hero background) and render them in the UI from frontend/public/assets/generated (no backend image serving).

Add a monetization configuration system that lets an authenticated admin choose and configure how the platform earns revenue (e.g., commission per booking, listing fee, featured placement fee, or lead fee), with exactly one active monetization model at a time.
Add an admin UI page for monetization settings where admins can select the monetization model, edit its parameters, and save the configuration.
Add an admin earnings dashboard page that shows revenue summaries and a table of recent fee records generated by the backend.
Connect booking lifecycle actions to monetization where applicable so platform revenue can be derived from booking activity (without adding real payment processing).
Add a self-service companion profile creation/editing flow for authenticated non-admin users so they can create and manage their own companion profile without using the admin profile editor.

Enforce a one-time ₹10 fee to create a companion profile: the first time a Principal creates a companion profile, the backend must require a "fee confirmation" input and record ₹10 as platform earnings; subsequent edits by the same Principal must not charge again.

Add a user-facing UI to create a companion profile (non-admin) that clearly shows the one-time ₹10 creation fee, collects the required profile fields, and submits to the new self-service backend APIs.

Implement free in-app messaging between matched users, where messaging access is only granted to users who have a valid match relationship, and sending/reading messages does not create any fees or modify platform earnings.

Define and implement what constitutes a "match" for messaging access using existing domain objects, and expose backend query APIs for the frontend to determine which conversations a user is allowed to access.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create an app and website for a gigolo escort service (Playboy-style).
Persist all core data in the Motoko backend (profiles, booking requests, admin allowlist) with stable query/update APIs suitable for React Query usage.
Add monetization options so the site owner can earn revenue from user activity (e.g., commission per booking, subscriptions, listing/featured placement fees, or lead fees).
Implement backend earnings/fee recording so the app can track how much revenue the platform has earned from user activity based on the active monetization model.
Enable self-service user profile creation (users can create their own profiles instead of admin-only creation/editing).
Add free in-app chat for matched users (real-time messaging).
Add a paywall/fee: charge a one-time ₹10 payment to create a user profile.
